item.title: Algorithms
item.description: What is Algorithm? An algorithm is a sequence of computational steps that solves a well-defined computational problem. It takes some input and produces some output correctly in a finite amount of time (it halts). An instance of a problem consists of the input needed to compute a solution to the problem. Model of computation Sorting Reduction Reduction is a technique used in designing algorithms that involves writing an algorithm for one problem, X, using an algorithm for another problem, Y, as a subroutine.

item.title: Rust
item.description: https://doc.rust-lang.org/book 1. rustup rustup is a command line tool for managing Rust versions and associated tools. $ curl --proto '=https' --tlsv1.3 https://sh.rustup.rs -sSf | sh # MacOS $ xcode-select --install 2. Hello, World! # Use an `_` to separate multiple words in your filename. $ touch hello_world.rs // hello_world.rs // `main` function is the entry point of every Rust program. fn main() { // `println!` calls a Rust macro. // End the line with a `;`.
